title: Create GET /config endpoint
description:
Implement endpoint to expose available configuration options to frontend.

## Endpoint: GET /api/config

## Response Schema
```json
{
  "styles": [
    {"id": "ios", "name": "iOS Modern", "description": "Standard iOS app icon style"},
    {"id": "flat", "name": "Flat Design", "description": "Minimalist flat design"},
    {"id": "vector", "name": "Vector", "description": "Vector illustration style"},
    {"id": "custom", "name": "Custom", "description": "Full custom prompt"}
  ],
  "defaults": {
    "variations": 4,
    "steps": 30,
    "guidance_scale": 7.0,
    "remove_background": true,
    "apply_mask": true
  },
  "limits": {
    "variations": {"min": 1, "max": 8},
    "steps": {"min": 20, "max": 50},
    "guidance_scale": {"min": 5.0, "max": 15.0}
  },
  "ios_sizes": [1024, 180, 167, 152, 120, 76, 60, 40, 29, 20]
}
```

## Purpose
- Frontend can dynamically build UI from available options
- No hardcoded values in frontend
- Easy to add new styles later

## Files to Create
- `src/icon_generator/api/routes/config.py`

## Dependencies
- ios-app-icons-dh6 (FastAPI setup)
close_reason: Implemented as part of FastAPI setup

title: Build icon results gallery component
description:
Create component to display generated icons with download options.

## Component: IconGrid.tsx / IconPreview.tsx

## Features
- Grid display of all generated variants
- Click to enlarge/preview individual variant
- Show all iOS sizes for selected variant
- Download options:
  - Download single size
  - Download all sizes (zip)
  - Download original (pre-processed)
- Variant comparison view (side-by-side)

## Layout
```
┌─────────────────────────────────────┐
│  Generated Icons (4 variants)       │
├─────────┬─────────┬─────────┬───────┤
│ [img 1] │ [img 2] │ [img 3] │[img 4]│
│ ★Select │  Select │  Select │ Select│
└─────────┴─────────┴─────────┴───────┘

Selected Variant: 1
┌─────────────────────────────────────┐
│ iOS Sizes                           │
│ 1024 | 180 | 167 | 152 | 120 | ...  │
│ [Download All] [Download Original]  │
└─────────────────────────────────────┘
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- All variants display correctly
- Images load without CORS issues
- Downloads work for all sizes
- Responsive layout on mobile

## Dependencies
- ios-app-icons-t24 (Frontend setup)
- ios-app-icons-az2 (File serving endpoint)
close_reason: Implemented as part of initial setup

title: Implement job queue and background task system
description:
Create a background task system for handling long-running icon generation.

## Problem
Icon generation takes 30-120 seconds. Need async job handling so API returns immediately.

## Tasks
- Create job manager class to track generation jobs
- Implement in-memory job queue (upgrade to Redis later if needed)
- Add job states: pending, processing, completed, failed
- Store job metadata: id, status, progress, result paths, errors
- Implement cleanup for old completed jobs

## Design
```python
class JobManager:
    def create_job(params) -> job_id
    def get_job(job_id) -> JobStatus
    def update_job(job_id, status, result)
    def run_job(job_id)  # Background thread
```

## Files to Create
- `src/icon_generator/api/jobs.py` - JobManager and JobStatus classes

## Acceptance Criteria
- Jobs can be created, tracked, and completed
- Concurrent generations don't block each other
- Failed jobs have error details stored
close_reason: Implemented as part of FastAPI setup

title: Create GET /status/{job_id} endpoint
close_reason: Implemented as part of initial setup

title: Create static file serving for generated icons
description:
Implement file serving endpoint to download generated icon files.

## Endpoint: GET /api/files/{path}

## Implementation
- Serve files from the output directory
- Support paths like: `{job-output-dir}/originals/variant-1.png`
- Set correct Content-Type headers (image/png)
- Add cache headers for completed generations
- Security: Validate paths are within output directory (prevent path traversal)

## Alternative: Configure FastAPI StaticFiles
```python
from fastapi.staticfiles import StaticFiles
app.mount("/files", StaticFiles(directory="output"), name="files")
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- Generated icons are downloadable via HTTP
- Path traversal attacks are prevented
- Images display correctly in browser

## Files to Modify
- `src/icon_generator/api/main.py` (add static file mount)

## Dependencies
- ios-app-icons-dh6 (FastAPI setup)
close_reason: Implemented as part of FastAPI setup

title: Epic: Convert CLI to REST API with Frontend
description:
Convert the iOS app icon generator from a CLI tool to a web application with:

## Goals
- REST API backend using FastAPI
- Frontend web interface to consume the API
- Maintain all existing functionality (generation, processing, styles)

## Current Architecture
- `src/icon_generator/generator.py` - IconGenerator class (Replicate SDXL integration)
- `src/icon_generator/processor.py` - IconProcessor class (image processing, iOS sizes)
- `src/icon_generator/prompts.py` - IconPrompts class (style templates)
- `src/icon_generator/config.py` - Config class (settings, API token)
- `src/icon_generator/cli.py` - Click CLI (to be replaced/supplemented)

## Key Requirements
- Async job handling (generation takes 30-120 seconds)
- File serving for generated icons
- Progress/status tracking
- All existing CLI parameters exposed via API
close_reason: Epic complete - CLI converted to REST API with React frontend

## Tasks

- Create `src/icon_generator/api/` directory structure:
  - `__init__.py`

  - `routes/` - API route handlers
  - `schemas.py` - Pydantic request/response models
  - `dependencies.py` - Shared dependencies (config, etc.)

## Acceptance Criteria

- Health check endpoint returns 200
- CORS configured for local development

## Files to Create

- `src/icon_generator/api/schemas.py`
- `src/icon_generator/api/routes/__init__.py`
close_reason: Setup complete - FastAPI backend and React/Vite frontend scaffolding created

title: Build job status and progress component
description:
Create component to display generation progress and handle polling.

## Component: JobStatus.tsx

## Features
- Display current job status (pending/processing/completed/failed)
- Progress bar with percentage
- Status message display
- Auto-polling while job is in progress (every 2-3 seconds)
- Stop polling when completed or failed
- Error display with retry option
- Transition to results view when completed

## States to Handle
1. **Pending**: "Your icons are queued for generation..."
2. **Processing**: Progress bar + "Generating variant 2 of 4..."
3. **Completed**: Auto-transition to results grid
4. **Failed**: Error message + "Try Again" button

## Implementation
```typescript
const { data, isLoading } = useQuery({
  queryKey: ['job', jobId],
  queryFn: () => fetchJobStatus(jobId),
  refetchInterval: (data) => 
    data?.status === 'completed' || data?.status === 'failed' 
      ? false 
      : 3000
});
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- Progress updates in real-time
- No memory leaks from polling
- Graceful error handling

## Dependencies
- ios-app-icons-t24 (Frontend setup)
- ios-app-icons-9zn (Status endpoint)

title: Build icon generation form component
description:
Create the main form component for submitting icon generation requests.

## Component: GenerateForm.tsx

## Features
- Subject input (required, text field)
- Style selector (dropdown with ios/flat/vector/custom options)
- Custom style textarea (shown only when style=custom)
- Variations slider (1-8)
- Advanced options accordion:
  - Steps slider (20-50)
  - Guidance scale slider (5.0-15.0)
  - Remove background toggle
  - Apply iOS mask toggle
- Submit button with loading state
- Form validation with error messages

## Data Flow
1. Fetch config from GET /api/config on mount
2. Populate form defaults and limits from config
3. On submit: POST /api/generate
4. Redirect to status/results page with job_id

## Acceptance Criteria
- Form renders with all fields
- Validation prevents invalid submissions
- Custom style field appears/hides based on style selection
- Loading state shown during submission

## Dependencies
- ios-app-icons-t24 (Frontend setup)
- ios-app-icons-35l (Config endpoint for dynamic form options)
close_reason: Implemented as part of initial setup

title: Create POST /generate endpoint
description:
Implement the main generation endpoint that accepts icon generation requests.

## Endpoint: POST /api/generate

## Request Schema
```json
{
  "subject": "happy cat",           // required
  "style": "ios",                    // ios|flat|vector|custom
  "custom_style": null,              // required if style=custom
  "variations": 4,                   // 1-8
  "steps": 30,                       // 20-50
  "guidance_scale": 7.0,             // 5.0-15.0
  "remove_background": true,
  "apply_mask": true,
  "process": true
}
```

## Response Schema
```json
{
  "job_id": "uuid-string",
  "status": "pending",
  "created_at": "2024-01-01T00:00:00Z"
}
```

## Implementation
- Validate request parameters
- Create job in JobManager
- Kick off background generation task
- Return job_id immediately

## Files to Modify/Create
- `src/icon_generator/api/routes/generate.py`
- `src/icon_generator/api/schemas.py` (add GenerateRequest, GenerateResponse)

## Dependencies
- ios-app-icons-dh6 (FastAPI setup)
- ios-app-icons-9ye (Job queue)
close_reason: Implemented as part of initial setup

title: Integrate frontend with backend and add E2E flow
description:
Wire up all components and test the complete flow end-to-end.

## Tasks
- Connect GenerateForm to POST /api/generate
- Connect JobStatus to GET /api/status/{job_id}
- Connect IconGrid to file serving endpoint
- Add React Router for navigation:
  - `/` - Generate form
  - `/job/{job_id}` - Status/Results page
- Handle API errors gracefully
- Add loading states throughout

## E2E Test Flow
1. User enters "happy cat" as subject
2. Selects "ios" style
3. Clicks Generate
4. Sees progress updates
5. Views generated variants
6. Downloads preferred icon

## Acceptance Criteria
- Complete flow works without errors
- Error states handled gracefully
- Navigation works correctly
- API responses display properly

## Dependencies
- ios-app-icons-pyd (Generate endpoint)
- ios-app-icons-9zn (Status endpoint)
- ios-app-icons-az2 (File serving)
- ios-app-icons-ph6 (Form component)
- ios-app-icons-e7d (Status component)
- ios-app-icons-9xb (Gallery component)
close_reason: Integration verified - both frontend and backend work together

title: Create frontend project with React/Vite
description:
Set up the frontend project to consume the icon generation API.

## Tech Stack
- React 18+ with TypeScript
- Vite for bundling
- Tailwind CSS for styling
- React Query for API state management

## Project Structure
```
frontend/
├── src/
│   ├── components/
│   │   ├── GenerateForm.tsx
│   │   ├── JobStatus.tsx
│   │   ├── IconPreview.tsx
│   │   └── IconGrid.tsx
│   ├── hooks/
│   │   └── useGeneration.ts
│   ├── api/
│   │   └── client.ts
│   ├── App.tsx
│   └── main.tsx
├── package.json
├── vite.config.ts
└── tailwind.config.js
```

## Tasks
- Initialize Vite + React + TypeScript project
- Add Tailwind CSS
- Add React Query
- Configure proxy for API calls during development
- Create basic App shell with routing

## Acceptance Criteria
- `npm run dev` starts frontend on port 5173
- API calls proxy to backend on port 8000
- Basic page loads without errors

## Dependencies
- None (can start in parallel with backend)
close_reason: Setup complete - FastAPI backend and React/Vite frontend scaffolding created
